A while back Electronic Arts tried to launch a game that would be completely interactive in your daily life. Not just at the computer but using your phone, fax, and any other medium handily available. You were supposed to get breathless calls that would freak you out making you constantly wonder if you were in the game or not. That was the theory anyway. An interesting premise to be sure unfortunately it launched right before 9/11/01 and so it got cancelled very quickly after a few embarrassing incidents (at least that's what I read). What does this have to do with anything? My friend Sean linked to this site in his blog( urlLink http://www.bloglines.com/blog/SCLiddle ) today: urlLink http://ilovebees.com Being the curious monkey I am I dug into it a little bit and very quickly stumbled upon this site: urlLink http://www.argn.com What the heck could this be about? Well how about the dictionary definition: urlLink http://www.unfiction.com/glossary/#arg Alternate Reality Gaming. Wow. Its nice to see people evolving the form of interactive storytelling. Although if ilovebees.com is just a marketing ploy for Halo 2 it'll be quite disappointing.

Finally a truly balanced and non-biased look at politics. Everyone should go check out urlLink www.spinsanity.org These guys are doing what the mainstream media should be; questioning the talking points and relentless spin being offered by our government. Their new book is great and I highly reccommend it, although from my experience most conservatives label anything that might suggest that the President is anything other than perfect as "liberal media." So if you're liberal or just open minded give the book a read it really opens your eyes to what to watch for on the nightly news coverage of the election coming up. Buy the book here: urlLink http://www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/ASIN/0743262514/spinsanity-20/

This morning I lost an hour and a half of my life that I can never get back sitting in the most pointless "communications" meeting ever. Did I learn anything useful? Only that you can tell our software group in India the same answer to the same question asked 5 times and they STILL don't understand "we don't know yet". I am rattling the bars of my cage now. I can't take being cooped up and not given anything useful to do. I can see now why many engineers who become managers seem to hate it so much. Just give me a task to do and let me go do it. Don't waste my time with bullshit meetings and blatherings from people who have no business getting to call themselves "engineers". When an agenda item says "status update" it does not mean that the people at the meeting want a detailed analysis of your project's architecture. GAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAH.
